}}{{TIDTOC|adapter}} ==Overview== The [[NEC]] D720113GK 7-port USB controller provides the 4 USB 2.0 ports on Ports 1-4. :Port 2 provides USB Serial via an [[Analog Devices]] ADM211 RS-232 Driver/Receiver. Port 5 drives ''Magic Control Technology Corp.'' USB to VGA which uses a [[SiS]] 315E VGA :chip and an ''EtronTech'' EM638325TS-6G 8MB RAM to provide VGA video output. Port 6 connects to the [[Texas Instruments]] TUSB2036 3-Port Full Speed USB 2.0 Hub. :Port 6 uses an [[ADMtek]] AN8515 chip to provide 10/100 Ethernet. Port 1 - The [[Texas Instruments]] TUSB2036 USB Hub uses Port 1 to provide USB audio :via a ''C-Media'' CM108 USB Audio I/O Controller.
:;Additional Chips * 8-bit Micro-controller: [[NXP]] P87C52X2 * 4kb Microwire Serial CMOS EEPROM: ''CSI'' 93C66V * Dual USB High-Side Power Switch: ''Analog Integrations Corp.'' AIC1528 * Universal Serial Bus Peripheral Controller with Parallel Bus: [[NXP]] PDIUSBD12
===Specifications=== * 4x USB 2.0 Ports (first 2 with charging capability) * VGA Video up to 1024x768 32-bit color * 10/100 Ethernet port, 9-pin Serial port * 3.5mm Audio In, 3.5mm Audio Out
[[Category:English Documentation]]
